Visualization¶

Created on Wed Oct 24 16:35:05 2018

@author: sadra

This part is only for visualization of 2D Polytopes

pypolycontain.visualization.visualize_2D.vcube(T)¶

Description: 2**n * n array of vectors of vertices in unit cube in R^n

pypolycontain.visualization.visualize_2D.visualize_2D(list_of_polytopes, a=1.5, title='polytopes', alpha=0.5)¶

Given a polytope in its H-representation, plot it

pypolycontain.visualization.visualize_2D.visualize_2D_AH_polytope(list_of_AH_polytopes, a=1.5, color=None, alpha=0.5, fig=None, ax=None, axis_limit=[0], title='AH-Polytopes', N=20, epsilon=0.001)¶
pypolycontain.visualization.visualize_2D.visualize_2D_ax(ax, list_of_polytopes, a=1.5, title='polytopes', color=False, alpha=0.5)¶

Given a polytope in its H-representation, plot it

pypolycontain.visualization.visualize_2D.visualize_2D_zonotopes(list_of_zonotopes, a=1.5, list_of_dimensions=None, title='zonotopes', axis_limit=[0], alpha=0.975, fig=None, ax=None, color=None)¶

Given a list of zonotopes, draw them. The zonotopes already have colors.

pypolycontain.visualization.visualize_2D.visualize_2D_zonotopes_ax(ax, list_of_zonotopes, a=1.5, list_of_dimensions=None, title='zonotopes', axis_limit=[0], alpha=0.5)¶

Given a plot, add zonotopes
